item.title: The Court of Justice of the European Union makes decisions regarding consent for cookies in accordance with data protection laws.
item.description:
Lorna Woods, Professor of Internet Law, University of Essex A significant ruling by the Court of Justice of the European Union (CJEU) concerning the use of cookies and the interpretation of consent under the e-Privacy Directive was issued last week in the Planet49 case. This ruling holds implications for comprehending cookie requirements under both the existing and forthcoming data protection regulations. Judgment At the heart of the matter was an online lottery requiring participants to provide their name and address...
